Sreymom and her husband sell sugarcane. They buy sugarcane from their fellow villagers under contract. This means that they pay money before the harvesting season and then they collect sugarcane to sell at Phnom Penh market. In addition, Sreymom also operates a business planning and decorating for weddings. Her husband also drives a taxi. 

Sreymom is applying for her first loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more sugarcane under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sugarcane for resale

loans.name: Laim

texts.en:
Laim is a garment worker, while her husband, Chantha is a construction worker. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have no children yet. 

Laim is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting because she does not have her own transportation. She spends lots of money for traveling costs.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Agasan

texts.en:
Agasan is 52 years old and is married with three children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food stuff like candies, sausages, macaroni, tinned food and juices. These are the most popular products.

Agasan has 20 years of experience selling food. During these years he gained the necessary experience and skills required to run a successful business. His monthly income is 250 AZN. His elder son helps him to sell in the shop.

He would like to diversify and purchase more food merchandise. This will help to increase sales and improve the living conditions of his family. He needs additional capital and for this purpose he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. This will be Agasan's third loan. He has positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Usoss

texts.en:
Usoss and his wife, Rim, live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2007. Usoss is a tuk tuk taxi driver. His wife sells clothes. She wants to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes for resale. Usoss has decided to apply for another loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to enable his wife to purchase clothes for resale.

Photo: Usoss and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal has a distinguished home-based business producing milk. She is a conservative person, unwilling to upload her picture on the internet; so the man in the photo is her husband. Manal is a 40-year-old married woman from Sahab, Jordan, and the mother of four children. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase equipment needed for producing milk. Manal is looking to expand her business and open a shop so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for producing milk

loans.name: Phari

texts.en:
Phari (pictured here) is 40 years old, and her husband Neat is 42 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phari and her husband are garment workers. She wants to launch a new pig-farming business to earn extra income, so she is asking for her first loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 37 años está casado con Alicia, con quien tiene 4 hijos: 2 gemelas de 16 años, y 2 jovencitos de 15 y 12 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
José trabaja desde que era un niño. A su corta edad ya trabajaba en los terrenos de cultivos de sus padres, así aprendió sobre la actividad agrícola, con la que actualmente, mantiene  a su familia. 
Cuenta con 2 lotes de café en producción y una parcela que acaba de renovar (sembrar pequeñas plantas). Además siembra cítricos como naranjas y limones.
“El año pasado coseché 40 sacos de café y los vendí a buen precio”, afirma.
Cuando el trabajo en las chacras no requiere de más cuidados, se dedica a laborar como jornalero en otras parcelas. Así obtiene otros ingresos para sus gastos diarios.
Toda su producción la comercializa en el mercado de frutas Pichanaki, ahí llegan compradores de varias ciudades, quienes pagan un precio justo por sus cosechas.
Uno de sus propósitos es adquirir más terrenos. Para eso deberá invertir en la compra o arriendo de las mismas, ya que las ventas de café y achiote son más que beneficiosas. Éste sería su crédito número 3 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar las cuotas mensuales con puntualidad. Su banco comunal se llama “Productores Inchatingari”, menciona sentirse a gusto con sus compañeros por la organización y el orden que practican como grupo.
Invertirá el dinero en 2 mil plantitas de café y abonos orgánicos para completar la parcela que sembró hace poco. Así también pagará la mano de obra de los jornaleros, quienes aportarán en esta actividad.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old.   He is married to Alicia and they have four children: sixteen year old twins, and two youngsters, ages 15 and 12.  The family lives in the indigenous community of Inchatingari, district of Perené, province de Chanchamayo.  

José has been working since he was a child, and at a young age, he was already working on his parents’ farm. In this way, he learned about agriculture, which is how he supports his family today.  

He has two coffee plots in production and a parcel of land that he has just cleared in order to plant small plants.  In addition, he grows citrus fruits such as oranges and lemons.  “Last year, he harvested 40 sacks of coffee and sold them at a good price”, he says.  When the work on the farms doesn’t require added care, he works as a laborer on other farms.  In this way, he earns extra income for his daily expenses.  He sells all of his produce at the Pichanaki fruit market, where buyers come from various cities and pay him a fair price for his harvest.  

One of his goals is to acquire more land, which he must either purchase or lease.  Sales of coffee and achiote (a spice made from the red seed of the annatto tree) are more than profitable, and will enable him to achieve this goal.  This will be his third loan with MFP and he accepts responsibility for making his monthly payments on time.  His communal bank is called “Productores Inchatingari”, and he says that he feels comfortable with his companions because of the organized and orderly manner in which the group works.  

He will invest the funds in two thousand coffee plants and organic fertilizer to finish the parcel of land that he had cultivated a short time ago.  He will also pay day laborers, who will assist him with this chore.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and sacks of fertilizer, and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao (shown at home) and her husband, Sie, have a young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sreymao's husband is a fisherman, and she sells fish that her husband catches. In addition, the couple also grows rice, lotus and watermelons.

Previously, Sreymao had asked Kiva for a loan. She is now applying for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira de 65 años, está casada con Julio, con quien tiene 9 hijos, pero sólo vive con 5. Esta numerosa familia vive unida en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, Chanchamayo.
Elvira es una mujer luchadora. Lleva más de 50 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Empezó di niña, ayudando a sus padres, por esa razón aprendió con facilidad sobre esta actividad. Cuando se casó tuvo que intensificar sus labores, ya que venían en camino los hijos. Con la ayuda de su esposo cultiva café, limón y naranjas, en sus 3 lotes de terrenos de cultivos.
“Las naranjas son bien solicitadas, cada jaba (canasta) la vendo a 8 soles”, comenta. Teniendo en cuenta que ofrece más de 200 jabas en una cosecha, Elvira obtiene los ingresos económicos suficientes para mantener a su familia.
El café es el producto que más satisfacciones le da, pero también tiene que invertir dinero y tiempo. Ella está complacida con sus labores, por eso continuará con sus sembríos hasta que vea a sus hijos grandes e independientes, “luego ya no me preocuparé mucho, sembraré solo para comer”, finaliza. Éste sería su préstamo número 3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Le gusta el trabajo en equipo, por la solidaridad que practican en su banco comunal “Los Productores inchatingari”. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes naturales, de plantitas de café para renovar sus cultivos y para el pago de los jornaleros a quienes pagará para desarrollar esta labor.
texts.en:
Elvira is 65 years old and married to Julio.  They have nine children but only five live with them.  This large family lives in a home of their own in the Inchatingari community, within the Perené district of Chanchamayo.


Elvira is a woman who tries very hard and has been farming for more than 50 years.  She began helping her parents as a little girl, so she was easily able to learn these skills.  When she married, she had to increase her work, because the children would be coming.  With her husband’s help, she raises coffee, lemons and oranges on the three plots of farmland.


“The oranges are well sought after and I sell each basket for 8 PEN,” she tells us.  Keeping in mind that she gets 200 baskets out of each harvest, Elvira earns enough income to support her family.
 

Coffee gives her the greatest satisfaction, but she also has to invest time and money.  She is happy with her work and for this reason will continue raising her crops until she sees her children grown and on their own.   “Then I will only need to worry about planting to eat,” she says.


This will be the third loan she gets from MFP and she is committed to being on time with her monthly payments.  She likes teamwork because of the unity among the members of the “Los Productores inchatingari” communal bank.  She will use the money from this loan to buy bags of natural fertilizer to renew her coffee crops, and to pay for field hands.

loans.use: Comprar sacos de fertilizantes, plantas de café, contratar peones.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila is a 48-year-old housewife married to Mohammad, who works as a constructor. They have seven sons and daughters. To help support the family and improve their living conditions, Laila started a small retail business selling electronics and clothes at home. It has been three years since she started. Laila has applied for a loan to add more clothes to her inventory.

loans.use: to add more clothes to her inventory

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a married lady who lives with her husband and four children. Her son is also married and sells fruit from a cart. Her two elder daughters work, while her youngest daughter remains at home. Due to financial constraints, Zahida couldn’t provide education to her children.

Her husband is also a fruit seller and sells fresh quality seasonal fruits to his customers.

Zahida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to improve his business. With the loan investment he will buy different fresh seasonal fruits such as bananas, apples, and oranges in larger quantity. That will enable him to make more sales and earn a better income.

He has been operating his business for many years and Zahida is confident about his business success as a result of the loan investment.

Note:  In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zahida.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 33 years old and his wife, Sary, is 34 years old. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter who is in school. 

Ny is a rice farmer, while his wife is a garment worker. He is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase a water-pumping machine to spray his farm. He will also use part of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm.  

Photo: Ny is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pumping machine to spray his farm.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 36-year-old married guy. His wife is a housewife and they have a baby boy. Ahmad works in the painting business. He has applied for a loan to help his wife start a small retail business at home. He wants to buy blankets, clothes and heaters for her to sell.

loans.use: to buy blankets, clothes and heaters to start a new business

loans.name: Synuon

texts.en:
Synuon (pictured with her loom), age 36, is single. She lives with her parents and brother in a village on the Mekong River about 10 miles north of Phnom Penh.

Synuon is a weaver. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: buy weaving materials

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty de 28 años convive con Vicente, el padre de sus 6 hijos de 13, 12, 11, 7, 5 y 2 años de edad. Todos ellos habitan un hogar propio ubicado en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Betty empezó con las responsabilidades de ser madre a los 15 años. A esa edad tuvo que afrontar problemas y necesidades. Es así que se dedicó a la agricultura junto a su pareja. Ambos producen café, achiote, naranjas, y plátanos en 3 lotes de terrenos que su localidad les otorgó.
“Gracias al plátano podemos cubrir los gastos diarios. Cosechamos a la semana 70 kilos y lo vendemos a 80 céntimos cada uno”, comenta, afirmando la rentabilidad de este producto.
El café y el achiote son frutos que más satisfacciones le dan, por eso se esmera mucho en sus cuidados, para cosecharlos una vez al año.
Cuando sus cultivos están atendidos, Betty trabaja como jornalera en otras parcelas. Es una mujer que no se cansa fácilmente.
Gracias al trabajo coordinado, ella y Vicente pueden mantener a su numerosa familia brindándole los servicios básicos. Ahora quieren adquirir otros terrenos de cultivos para multiplicar su producción, pues les agrada el trabajo del campo.
Betty accedería a su crédito número 3 de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Comenta que el trabajo con su banco comunal “Los Productores Inchatingari” es satisfactorio gracias a la cultura de ahorro que se practica.
De recibir el dinero podrá pagar los servicios de los jornaleros que contratará para que limpien sus terrenos de la maleza y la mala yerba.
texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old and lives with Vicente, the father of her 6 children who are 13, 12, 11, 7, 5 and 2 years old. They live together in their own home located in the native community of Inchatingari, in the district of Perené, province of Chanchamayo. 

Betty began her responsibilities as a mother when she was 15 years old. At this age she had to face many problems and necessities. It's because of this that she began working in agriculture along with her partner. They both produce coffee, achiote, oranges, and bananas on 3 lots of land their locality granted them. 

"Thanks to the bananas we can cover our daily expenses. We harvest 70 kilos every week and we sell each one for 80 cents," she comments, affirming the profitability of this product. The coffee and achiote are fruits that give her more satisfaction, and because of this she takes great care of them in order to harvest them once a year. When her crops are being tended to, Betty works as a laborer on other plots of land. She is a women who doesn't tire easily. 

Thanks to their coordinated work, she and Vicente can maintain their large family providing them with the basic necessities. Now they would like to acquire other land to cultivate to multiply their production, as they like the field work.

Betty has reached her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and as a result gives her word that she will be punctual with the repayment of her monthly quotas. She tells us that the work she has done with her communal bank "Los Productores Inchatingari" is satisfactory thanks to the savings culture practiced. By receiving this money, she will be able to pay for the services of the laborers she will contract to rid the land of weeds.

loans.use: to contract laborers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer que ha trabajado mucho buscar salir adelante, además es amable y cordial. Está casada con José quien es comerciante y pero actualmente no trabaja por una enfermedad que lo aqueja, siendo el padre de sus hijos y todos ya mayores e independientes. Juntos habitan cómodamente la casa de su hijo en compañía de su nuera y un nieto al que quieren mucho y dedican cariños. La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de golosinas y gaseosas para esto cuenta con un espacio acondicionado en la casa de su hijo. Estos productos los compran en la distribuidora y los vende entre sus vecinos, siendo muy conocida por el tiempo que lleva en ese negocio.
Se inicio de a poco con un préstamo de MFP, comprando en pocas cantidades y viendo la acogida que tenia se decidió continuar y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja que lo emplea en el pago de sus gastos y reinvertir su capital.
Antes de comenzar con su negocio, tenía problemas económicos pues su pareja de avanzada edad sufre de salud y sus ingresos no son constantes, necesitando el apoyo económicos de sus hijos, por eso se decidió en iniciar  para apoyarse con sus gastos.
Espero de su negocio aumentar el stock de sus productos y verlo crecer para tener mayores ganancias. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Esta agradecida de saber que seguirá contando con una línea de crédito para seguir avanzando con su negocio. Por eso, comenta será responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 1300 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para su negocio como bebidas gaseosas y golosina para surtirlo, así tener un stock variado para la venta, y buscará precios más cómodos por sus compras al contado y volumen, para tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52, and a woman who has worked hard, seeking to get ahead. In addition she is warm and friendly. She is married to José, who is a business person, but who is currently not working because of an illness he suffers from. He is the father of her children, all of whom are now adults and independent. They live comfortably together in their son's house, along with their daughter-in-law, and a grandson whom they love dearly. 

Rosa sells candy and soft drinks, and for this has a space set up in her son's house. She buys these products from the distributor, and sells them among her neighbors. She is well-known, because of the time she has been in that business. She got started little by little with a loan from MFP, buying in small quantities, and on seeing the reception this had, decided to continue, so far doing this on her own.

She considers her business quite profitable because of the earnings it provides, and she uses these to pay her expenses and to reinvest in working capital. Before starting her business, she had financial problems, as her elderly husband has health problems; and as his income is not regular, he needs financial support from his children. That is why she decided to start the business, in order to support their expenses.   

She hopes to increase her business's stock of products, and see it grow, in order to have greater earnings. This will be her fifth loan with the MFP institution. She is thankful to know that she will continue to have a line of credit so that she can keep her business going. That is why she says that she will be responsible in paying her installments, as with her previous loans. In addition she says she is content with her communal bank as she considers it a close-knit and responsible group. 

She will use the amount of 1,300 nuevos soles applied for to purchase merchandise for her store such as soft drinks and candy, in order to supply it, and have a varied stock to sell. She will seek more convenient prices through her cash and volume purchases, in order to have greater profit margins.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and candy.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun (pictured with her loom), age 34, is a silk weaver. Her husband, Vanny, age 42, is an electrician. Saroeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.      

The couple lives in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two children, one son and one daughter, who are in school.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete her client orders on time and increase her income. Her current sewing machine has grown old and she is unable to manage her work properly. She is confident that by purchasing a new sewing machine she will be able to run her business better.

Amna’s husband operates a clothes selling business. He purchases clothes from a wholesale market in bulk quantity and sells through his shop at very reasonable rates.  

Amna has given birth to 3 sons and 2 daughters. Only her elder daughter could complete her education.  Amna is very hopeful about her family's better financial future as a result of her business improvement.

Note:  In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Amna.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Ali is a driver who recently started a small business at home with his wife, Mona, refilling detergents to sell. Mona is a conservative person who asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Mona is a 37-year-old married lady with two sons and two daughters. Mona has applied for this loan in order to increase their quantity of detergents and to buy smaller bottles for refilling.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of detergents

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en:
Qadir is a 49-year-old married man with two sons. He is an entrepreneur and keeps a café. He has four years of experience in the service field.

Qadir serves the local people with lunches, dinners and teas.  People in Azerbaijan like to have lunch of national dishes in cafes. Also, spending long evenings at tea is one of the main activities of the local people.  Qadir starts his job early in the morning to prepare the national dishes for lunch. He says that the most popular dishes are soups and dolma.  His monthly income is 260 AZN.

Qadir has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will use this loan to purchase plastic chairs, new plates and tableware.

loans.use: buy equipment for his cafe

loans.name: Aniga

texts.en: Aniga lives in Yerevan with her son and two grand-daughters. Aniga is an experienced sewer. She has been sewing clothing and different kinds of fabrics for many years. Aniga has a large number of clients and receives many orders. Now Aniga has some big orders but she doesn't have enough means to purchase the necessary materials. Aniga plans to use this loan to purchase the necessary textile to finish the orders.  She hopes to increase her sales and get additional income, which will allow her to expand the business in the future. Aniga will also improve the conditions in her household and insure better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: buy fabrics

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan is a 34-year-old responsible and friendly man.  He is married and has three children.  He sells food products such as macaronis, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop.  Sanan has 6 years of experience in this field. He is a knowledgeable and skilled person in his trade.

The food product he sells is very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 230 AZN. His wife helps him to sell the oducts in the shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location of his shop, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Nadir would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for 1000 AZN to purchase and diversify additional foodstuff.

loans.use: buy more food products

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger, es originario de la comarca La esperanza. Municipio de Yalaguina departamento de Madriz al norte de Estelí. Inicio sus actividades hace 30 años después que aprendió el oficio como ayudante de carpintería en Managua. Luego fue ajuntando un poco de dinero y puso su propio taller en su ciudad de origen. Poco a poco atravez de los años fue creciendo su negocio y fue comprando herramientas de trabajo hasta lograr tener lo que es hoy un taller completo y este ha sido su primer negocio.     					                                         
No tiene otros ingresos, tiene como expectativas ampliar su negocio y captar más clientes  para incrementar sus ventas. El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de materia prima tales como pegamento, madera de uso renovable, tornillos, pintura para darle una mejor textura a los muebles. Con este préstamo estima producir mas. Actualmente lo apoya solamente su esposa y sus hijos, su producto lo comercializa en su taller ubicado en su localidad.
texts.en:
Roger is from the region of La Esperanza, municipality of Yalaguina, department of Madriz to the north of Estelí. He began his activities here 30 years ago, after he learned his trade as an apprentice in a carpentry shop in Managua. Later he saved a bit of money and installed his own shop in his city of origin. Little by little throughout the years he grew his business and bought tools to be able to have what is today a complete shop, and this has been his first business. 

He does not have other income, and he expects to grow his business and attract more clients to improve his sales. He asked for this loan to buy raw materials such as glue, timber, screws, and paint to give a better texture to the furniture he makes. With this loan he expects to produce more. Currently he alone supports his wife and children, and he markets his products in his shop located in his town.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as glue, timber, screws, and paint to give a better texture to the furniture he makes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 31 años que tiene sus metas bien trazadas, está casada con Abelardo con quien tiene 2 hijos: Verónica y Anthony. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Yolanda es una mujer fuerte y de mucha persistencia. La mayoría de los días de la semana se dirige hacia los terrenos que arrienda para asegurarse de que sus productos estén bien cuidados. Ella siembra papa, arvejas, y flores de gladiolos. El trabajo es intenso, por eso contrata personal operario para culminar con las labores. Mientras su esposo realiza servicio de transporte público con su propio vehículo (auto). Los objetivos de Yolanda son muy claros, ella también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de semilla de papa, esta actividad le gusta porque obtiene ingresos económicos provechosos que le permiten vivir cómodamente y pagar una adecuada educación para sus hijos en la ciudad. Sus esfuerzos son reconocibles, ya que la distancia que tiene que recorrer le toma más de una hora. Es consciente que, de esa manera sus satisfacciones ser´na mas gratas. Con el tiempo anhela construir una casa en la ciudad para que sus pequeños no se cansen viajando constantemente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su préstamo número 10 con  MFP, agradece el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de cada una de las cuotas. Está contenta de pertenecer a un grupo comunal sólido y responsable.
Yolanda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 1 saco de semillas de arvejas con 600 soles, los que piensa completar con algunos ahorros que tenía guardado.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 31 year old woman who has her goals well developed. She is married to Abelardo with whom she has 2 children: Verónica and Anthony.They live in their own house located in the small village of Cumutay, district of Huasahuasi. Yolanda is a strong woman with a lot of persistence. The majority of the days of the week she devotes herself to the land that she leases to ensure that her products are well cared for. She plants potatoes, peas, and gladiola flowers. The work is intense, and as a result she contracts personnel to help with the labor. All the while, her husband works for his public transportation service with his own vehicle (car). Yolanda's objectives are very clear. She also dedicates herself to the business of the purchase and sale of potato seeds, and she likes this activity because she obtains helpful income that allows her to live comfortably and pay for an adequate education for her children in the city. Her efforts are recognized, as the distances that she has to travel take her more than an hour. With time she hopes to build a house in the city so that her children don't tire traveling constantly. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this will be her 10th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, thanks to the support of all of you. She promises to be punctual with the payment of her quotas. She is happy to belong to a solid and responsible communal group. 

Yolanda, upon receiving your support, will invest the money being asked for in the purchase of 1 sack of pea seeds (costs 600 Soles) which she plans to complement with some savings that she has made.

loans.use: to buy sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida de 39 años de edad madre soltera con 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Ida es una gran persona de buen corazón, tiene 4 hijos de la que es madre y padre a la vez. De los cultivos que tiene trata de sacarle la mayor producción con la finalidad de darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. 
Usualmente trabaja con sus hijos cultivando cacao, café en su parcela ubicada cerca de su casa. 
Sus productos generalmente los vende en el distrito de Llochegua al mejor postor; pero mas adelante esta pensando abrir una tienda de abarrotes en Pichari con la finalidad de que sus hijos estudien en dicha ciudad y puedan mantenerse con ello, mientras que su ella continuase con las labores agrícolas. 
Está contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le genera un buen ingreso económico, por ello esta en constante mantenimiento, fetilizándolo, podándolo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete una vez mas en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 4,000 nuevos soles incrementara sus cultivos de cacao como también mandara a limpiar las malezas, para ello contratará jornaleros.
texts.en:
Ida, age 39, is the single mother of four children.  They live in their own house in the Pichari district.  Ida is a great person with a big heart.  She is both mother and father to her four children.  She tries to get the greatest production from her crops in order to give her children a better education.  

She usually works with her children cultivating cacao and coffee on her parcel of land near her house.  She generally sells her products to the highest bidder in the Llochegua district.  However, she is thinking of opening a grocery store in Pichari later on.  She would do this so that her children could go to school in that city. They would be able to support themselves with the store while she continues with her agricultural work.

She is happy with the work she does because it generates good income for her.  Therefore, she is constantly performing maintenance, fertilizing, and pruning her crops.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She pledges to once more make her payments punctually.  She will use the 4,000 soles to increase her cacao crops.  She will also hire day workers to clear the weeds from her parcel.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. She is a very supportive lady and started her business a few years ago to assist her husband financially. With the loan investment, Rashida will purchase clothes in bulk quantity at wholesale rates to further expand her business.

Rashida has given birth to 3 sons and all of them do different kinds of work to support the family.  Her husband works in a mill for a low income. Rashida is a very good housewife too and performs her household duties very well.  She is very confident that she will get more success in her business after investing the loan.

Note:  In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rashida.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is a construction worker and also assists his wife in her business when he is free. His wife, Kunthea, produces rice wine and raises pigs at home. Chheng had previously asked for Kiva loan to help with his wife’s business by purchasing more piglets to raise and buying rice to produce more rice wine. He now is asking for another loan of $1,000 to assist his wife in continuing her business. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets to raise and more rice to produce rice wine.

Chheng and his wife have been married since 1993 and they have three children who attend school: two sons and one daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: buy piglets and rice

loans.name: Ipaknaz

texts.en:
Ipaknaz is a 55-year-old married woman with three children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaronis, butter and candies. She has ten years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients.
 
The food products she sells are very popular among the people and are in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 230 AZN.  Her husband helps to purchase the products and bring them to the shop. This business is the sole financial income for the family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location of her shop, in the central bazaar of her home city.

Ipaknaz applied for 1000  AZN to purchase more food and diversify her range of goods to cover customers' demand.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Savon and her husband, Lorn, live in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and five daughters. One of their children is married and lives in a separate home, two are garment workers, and one is a weaver. 

Savon is a farmer, she grows rice and lotus. She also sells fish in her village by bicycle. Her husband is a fisherman and drives a horse cart.  Unfortunately, his horse died and he cannot continue his business of driving his horse cart.  Hence Savon is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a horse for her husband and assist in her lotus farm by buying seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: buy a horse, lotus seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Barnogul

texts.ru: Барногул трудолюбивая и добросовестная молодая девушка. Более 13 лет она занимается хлебобулочных изделий. Она помогает своим родителям на содержание семьи. Барногул торгует на рынке и имеет много клиентов. Барногул хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки хлебобулочных изделий с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Barnogul is a hardworking and honest young woman.  For more than 13 years she has sold bakery goods.  She helps her parents provide for the family.  Barnogul sells at the market and has many customers.  Barnogul would like to take out a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy bakery goods with the goal of expanding her business.  She is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase bakery products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 36 años, está casada con Olo, con quien tiene 2 hijos jóvenes. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi.
Rosa, cuando era niña ayudaba a sus padres y hoy trabaja las tierras junto a su esposo. Todas las mañanas siembra papa, arverja y maíz en sus chacras propias, y le gusta despertarse muy temprano para vigilar sus campos, pues sabe que de su esfuerzo constante depende que obtenga un productiva cosecha que venderá a buenos precios a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Luego de la cosecha comercializa  todos sus productos naturales, pues sus compradores conocen de la calidad de su producción. Sus principales motivos son sus hijos, quienes le ayudan en el arduo trabajo. Ahora quiere que estudien una carrera y sean profesionales, además dice que lo más trabajoso es trasladar toda su producción para comercializarla, ya que los sacos son bastante pesados. Como es una mujer emprendedora para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para generarse mejores ingresos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy agradecida de trabajar tanto años con la entidad. Razón por la que promete ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. Le gusta el trabajo con su banco comunal por que son solidarios entre ellos.
Rosa  de recibir su apoyo; comprará 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 2400 soles, lo restante lo destinará a la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36 years old, is married to Olo with whom she has 2 young children. She and her family live in their own house in the small village of Cumutay, district of Huasahuasi. 

As a child Rosa would help her parents, and today she works the land alongside her husband. Every morning they plant potatoes, peas and corn on their own land, and she likes to wake up very early to look after their fields, as she knows obtaining a productive harvest, that she will sell at good prices to wholesalers in the city, depends on their constant efforts. After the harvest she markets all of their products, so that buyers know of the quality of her goods. Her principal motivation is her children, who help her in this arduous work. Now she wants them to study a career and become professionals.  Additionally, she says that the most difficult work is transporting all of her products and marketing them, as the sacks are quite heavy. As she is an entrepreneurial women, she has planned in advance to plant in greater quantities, in order to generate better income. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Dumutay" and this will be her 10th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very grateful to have worked so many years with the entity, which is the reason why she promises to be punctual with every one of her quotas. She likes the work of the communal bank because of the solidarity between members.

Rosa, upon receiving your support, will buy 4 bags of pea seeds which will cost 2,400 Soles. The rest of the money will be used to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Siney

texts.en:
Siney (in the photo with her granddaughter) is a 49-year-old widowed mother of two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons are construction workers, while her married daughter is a garment worker. The family lives in a village about 15 kilometers form Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

The main source of income for Siney is from her children’s salary. She is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for her sons to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her sons to get to work.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura de 42 años está casada con David, con quien tiene 5 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre 20 y 1 año. Laura y su familia viven bajo un techo propio en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, Chanchamayo. 
Las actividades de Laura son varias desde que los rayos solares alumbran a su comunidad. Ella atiende su hogar y familia para que ellos también inicien sus actividades diarias. Al culminar sus labores del hogar, se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivos.
Actualmente cuenta con 3 lotes de tierras fértiles, en ellas siembra achiote, café, y cítricos como tanyelos y naranjas. “Siembro de todo, pero lo que me conviene más es el café y el achiote por su demanda en todo el año”, afirma.
La producción de achiotes es común en su localidad. Cada cosecha le otorga 2500 kilos, cada kilo lo vende desde 5 a 7 soles. En estos días el precio es bajo, llegando a los 4 soles y 50 céntimos, pero tiene la seguridad que, a partir de abril, el precio será beneficioso para ella.
Gracias a su esfuerzo puede asegurar el alimento, vestido y educación de sus hijos. Sus metas más cercanas son ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos y mejorar su producción, para eso deberá invertir en la compra de terrenos y fertilizantes.
Éste sería su préstamo número 3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales, como lo hizo antes. “Los productores Inchatingari” es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo sólido y trabajador.
De obtener el dinero del crédito podrá comprar bolsas de fertilizantes. Además pagará los servicios de los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de la mala yerba y otros arbustos.
texts.en:
Laura is 42 years and married to David.  They have five children who range in age form one to twenty years old.  Laura and her family live under their own roof in the indigenous community of Inchatingari, district of Perené, province of Chanchamayo. 

Laura begins a variety of activities the moment the first rays of sun shine over her community.  She takes care of her home and family so that they can also begin their daily activities.  After she finishes her household chores, she takes care of her farmland.

Currently, she has three plots of fertile land, in which she plants achiote (a spice made from the red seed of the annatto tree), coffee, and citrus fruits such as tangelos (hybrid fruit that is a cross between a grapefruit and a tangerine) and oranges.  “I grow it all, but coffee and achiote are best for me as there is demand throughout the year”, she says.  

Production of achiote is common in her region.  Each harvest yields 2500 kilos and each kilo sells for between 5 and 7 soles. These days, the price is low reaching 4 soles and 50 céntimos.   However, she is certain that, beginning in April, the price will be profitable for her.  

Thanks to her hard work, her children are assured food, clothing, and an education.  Her immediate goals are to expand her farmland and improve production, and in order to achieve them, she must invest in the purchase of land and fertilizer.  

This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her monthly payments on time, as she has done in the past. “Los Productores Inchatingari” is the name of her communal bank and she feels happy to be a part of such a solid and hard-working group.  When she obtains the loan, she will be able to buy bags of fertilizer.  In addition, she will pay for the services of laborers who will clear her land of weeds and other shrubs.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 56 años. Está casado con Dionicia con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de ellos. Él, Dionicia y el menor de sus hijos viven en una casa propia en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Desde niño se dedica a la agricultura. Aprendió ayudando sus padres y de joven sus obligaciones fueron mayores, ya que su comunidad practica el trabajo solidario. En  la actualidad siembra papa y arvejas en sus chacras que son propias. La mayoría de sus hijos ya tienen familia y viven independientemente, aún así recibe el apoyo de ellos en los trabajos más cansados, que son las cosechas. Manuel lleva más de 30 años en esta actividad y asegura que los resultados obtenidos son gratificantes cuando comercializa sus productos. De esa manera educó a sus hijos y ellos en retribución le brindan su ayuda incondicional, ahorrándose el pago a operarios. Y como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar sus cultivos y comprar algunas cabezas de ganado, pues quiere dedicarse a la compra y venta de animales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 10  con MFP, esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Razón por lo que promete pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Manuel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas, cuyo precio es de 600 soles por cada una.
texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old. He is married to Dionicia with whom he has 7 children, but he only lives with the youngest of them. He, Dionicia and their youngest child live in their own house in the village of Cumutay, district of Huasahuasi. Ever since he was a child he has been working in agriculture. He learned helping his parents, and as a young man his obligations became greater as his community practices solidarity work. Currently he plants potatoes and peas on his own land. The majority of his children already have families and live independently, but even so he receives their support with the most tiring jobs which are the harvests. Manuel has been doing this work for more than 30 years and he assures that the results he has obtained are gratifying when he markets his products. In this way he educated his children and they in return have offered their unconditional help, saving him from having to pay hired workers. As he is an entrepreneurial man, he has planned to grow his crop output and buy some cattle, as he would like to also work in the purchase and sale of animals.

He belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this will be his 10th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He is very grateful for all of the people that made this loan possible and which have allowed him to continue working in search of progress. As a result, he promises to pay his quotas punctually. Manuel, upon receiving your support, will invest the money asked for in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seeds, which cost 600 Soles each.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru: Маъруф 1981 года рождения, он женат, у него 3 детей. Дома разводит скот в течении 12 лет, дети помогают по уходу за скотом. Маъруфу нравиться заниматься этим делом, потому что это основной его доход. В их кишлаке почти все занимаются откормом скота. Он получает первый кредит у нас для покупки скота, сейчас ему выгодно покупать, потому что в горах появятся много травы и будет чем кормить скот.
texts.en:
Maruf was born in 1981, is married, and has 3 children.  For 12 years, he has raised cattle at his home and his children help with their care and feeding.  Maruf likes this business because it is his main source of income.  In their village, almost everyone earns their living by fattening cattle.  

He is taking out his first loan for the purchase of cattle.  Now is a good time for him to buy:  soon there will be a lot of grass in the mountains and they'll have more than enough feed.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia, the mother of a son and daughter, could not provide them with educational opportunities due to financial constrains. An embroidery expert who learned her skills from her mother, Nazia now earns reasonable income from her work. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, providing transport services to his passengers.

Nazia is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to purchase thread, beads, etc. in order to make better quality embroidered clothes and increase her profits. Knowledgeable about the latest trends in fashion, she is confident that the loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beads, threads, etc. for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 53, lives in Mrgashat village with her husband and son. Emma has been keeping an orchard for 12 years, cultivating a variety of fruit trees, and now has plans to expand her business activities to breed cattle too.

With a barn and all of the equipment necessary to develop a cattle-breeding enterprise, Emma is requesting a loan to purchase cattle and forage. This will allow her to earn more income and ensure a stable financial future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 41 años es viudo. Tiene 6 hijos de 18, 15, 12, 10, 9 y 8. Todos ellos viven juntos en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Oscar es un hombre valiente y responsable. Desde que falleció su esposa tuvo que dedicarse a sus hijos en la alimentación y educación. 
Es por eso que Oscar se esfuerza mucho en el trabajo del campo para mantener a su numerosa familia. Cuenta con 7 parcelas de terrenos de cultivos, en ellos siembra café, achiote y cítricos como naranjas y limones.
Ahora tiene un lote entero de café renovado, es decir recién plantado. Éste cafetal tendrá que esperar 3 años como mínimo para ofrecer sus primeros granos. Oscar cuidará de estas plantas con paciencia y dedicación.
Él es un hombre emprendedor, por eso también compra y vende maderas de distintas variedades como: Muela, Tornillo y Alcanfor. “Estas maderas se venden rápido, las compran para hacer muebles resistentes”, menciona.
Con ambas actividades, Oscar puede estar seguro que educará a sus hijos. Por su parte ellos apoyan en las labores del hogar y los mayores ayudan en el trabajo del campo y en el negocio. Oscar obtendría su crédito número 3 de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además afirma sentirse cómodo en su banco comunal “Productores de Inchatingari”, por que sus integrantes son personas solidarias y responsables.
Destinará el dinero en el pago a los jornaleros que piensa contratar para la limpieza del cafetal. Así también comprará machetes y sables para estas actividades.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 41-year-old widower.  He has 6 children, ages 18, 15, 12, 10, 9, and 8.  They all live together in a house that Oscar owns in the community of Inchatingari, which is located in the district of Perené in the province of Chanchamayo.

Oscar is a courageous and responsible man.  Since his wife passed away he has dedicated himself to providing for his children’s sustenance and education.  He puts a lot of effort into his work in the field so he can support his large family.  He has 7 parcels of land under cultivation where he grows coffee, annatto, and citrus fruits such as oranges and lemons.

Oscar recently planted a whole new crop of coffee.  He will have to wait at least 3 years before this crop sprouts its first fruits, but he will care for the plants with patience and dedication in the meantime.

Oscar is an enterprising man, and in addition to his agricultural activities he also purchases and sells different types of wood such as ‘muela,’ ‘tornillo,’ and camphor.  As he notes, “These woods sell quickly, and people buy them for making durable furniture.”

Oscar is sure that between these two activities he will be able to provide his children with an education.  Oscar’s children, for their part, assist him with the household chores, and the oldest ones help him with his work in the field and with his wood business.

This would be Oscar’s third loan with MFP, and he promises to make all of his monthly payments on time.  He also says that he is glad to be part of the “Productores de Inchatingari” [“Producers of Inchatingari”] communal bank because its members are all supportive and responsible people.

Oscar will use the loan to pay day laborers that he plans to hire to clear weeds around his recently-planted coffee crop.  He will also purchase regular machetes and saber machetes to use for these activities.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and purchase machetes.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia de 42 años convive con su esposo Eusebio hace 16 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que quieren y cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Celia está contenta, después de muchos años de lucha y trabajo en la agricultura. Puede estar segura que su producción le brinda lo necesario y algo más para solventar sus gastos diarios y otras necesidades. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad, sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y maíz; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde viaja después de cada cosecha. Gracias a su trabajo pudo obtener los 5 terrenos cultivables que ahora posee, como también 2 toros de buena raza, con los cuales ara la tierra y los que alquila a otros agricultores a 25 soles por día,  “Nunca dejaré de sembrar, siempre mantendré la costumbre familiar”, comenta muy orgullosa Celia. Pues para el futuro desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos y ampliar sus terrenos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 10 que obtendría de MFP, gracias a su ayuda, espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas.
Celia de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas y con lo restante comprará bolsas de abonos.
texts.en:
Celia is 42 years old and lives with her husband of 16 years Eusebio. They have 3 children whom they love and care for in their own house, located in the small village of Cumutay, district of Huasahuasi. Celia is happy, after many years of struggle and work in agriculture. She can be sure that her production will provide her with what is necessary and a bit more to support her daily expenses and other necessities. She has been working in agriculture for 20 years now, and her principal crops consist of peas, potatoes and corn, all of which she markets at a good price in the main market of the city, where she travels after each harvest. Thanks to her work she was able to obtain 5 cultivatable plots of land that she now possesses, as well as 2 bulls with which she plows the land and which she rents to other farmers for 25 Soles per day. "I will never stop planting, I will always maintain the family custom," comments Celia proudly. However, for the future she would like to improve the quality of her products and enlarge her land.

She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay," and this will be the 10th loan she will obtain from Microfinanzas Prisma thanks to your support. She relies on your collaboration to continue with her goals. She promises to be punctual with her quotas. 

Celia, upon receiving your support, will invest the money in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seeds, and with the rest will purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.ru: Фатхулло женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более одного года он занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он ездит по местному маршруту и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Он всегда старается обслуживать своих клиентов хорошо, чтобы им было приятно ездит с ним. Фатхулло хотел бы получить займ в размере 11000 Сомони для покупки новой автомашины. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту
texts.en: Fathullo is married and is raising three children.  For more than a year he has provided taxi services.  He drives a along a local route and has many regular customers.  He always tries to give his customers great service so that they'll want to take his taxi again.  Fathullo would like to take a loan of 11,000 Somoni to buy a new car.  He is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) and her husband, Porng, have been married since 1995 and have three sons and one daughter. Two attend school and the others are still young. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Touch is now a cleaner, while her husband is a farmer and does construction work when he is free. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide and building a shelter to shade the vegetables from sunlight.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide and building a shelter to shade the vegetables from the sunlight.

loans.name: Huseyin

texts.en:
Huseyin is a 23-year-old man, single and living with his parents.  Huseyin has been breeding chickens, turkeys and geese for two years. After several attempts to find job he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his father, who invested in his business, Huseyin bought first poultry.

Huseyin usually sells poultry in the central bazaar or to private customers. His monthly income is 230 AZN. People in Azerbaijan eat poultry and use it in everyday dishes. Most popular dishes made of chicken and turkey are kabab (grilled meat) and different soups. Depending on the season the popularity of poultry  is different. For example, chicken is popular all year, turkey in spring and autumn, and goose in winter.
 
Huseyin wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase more poultry.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Danitza

texts.es:
Danitza de 22 años es una joven soltera y sin hijos. Vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos. Su hogar es humilde pero acogedor y se ubica en el caserío de Cayán, distrito de Huasahuasi.
Danitza, a su corta edad ya se dedica al los negocios. Gracias a su inteligencia e iniciativa ha logrado consolidar su pequeño comercio de quesos. Empezó elaborándolos ella misma, con la ayuda de su madre. Pero ahora maneja la administración ella sola. Cada semana compra de 30 a 60 moldes de quesos, dependiendo de sus pedidos, para negociarlos en la ciudad de La Oroya, todos los miércoles y jueves, (días de ferias).
Su localidad es una zona donde las vacas crecen libres, por ende la producción de quesos es masiva. Danitza compra los moldes a las propias pobladoras de su localidad.
“Compro cada molde a 4 soles y lo vendo a 7 y 8 soles”, menciona.
Además, cuando vuelve a Huasahuasi, por las tardes, se encarga de preparar salchipollos y hamburguesas, en el centro de la ciudad. Le va muy bien. Danitza obtendría su crédito número 6 de MFP, gracias a su ayuda, por eso se siente comprometida a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al grupo comunal “Unión por el Trabajo”, se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo solidario y participativo.
Ella destinará el préstamo, en dos partes: la mitad será para comprar más moldes de quesos y la otra para invertirlo en insumos para preparar sus hamburguesas.
texts.en:
Danitza is 22 years old and is a single young woman without children. She lives in the house of her parents with her siblings. Her home is humble but cozy and is located in the small village of Cayán, district of Huasahuasi. 

Daniza, at her young age is already has her own business. Thanks to her intelligence and initiative she has been able to start her small cheese business. She began making cheese with the help of her mother, but now she manages everything herself. Each week she buys 30 to 60 cheese molds, depending on her orders, to sell in the city of La Oroya, every Wednesday and Thursday (market days). 

Her town is in a region where cows roam free, and as a result there is significant cheese production. Danitza buys the cheese molds from other residents of her town. "I buy each mold at 4 Soles and sell at 7 or 8 Soles," she mentions. Additionally, when she returns to Huasahuasi in the afternoons, she works preparing sausages and hamburgers in the center of the city. It is going very well. 

Danitza will obtain her 6th credit from Microfinanzas Prisma, thanks to your help, and because of this is committed to being punctual with the payment of her monthly quotas. She belongs to the communal group "Unión por el Trabajo," and she is happy to be part of a solidarity and participatory group. 

She will use the loan for two things: half will be for the purchase of more cheese molds, and the other she will invest in the ingredients to prepare hamburgers.

loans.use: to buy cheese molds and ingredients for the preparation of hamburgers.

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Raksmey (in the photo) and her husband, Thaing, have been married since 2006 and have two young children--one son and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Raksmey is a weaver, while her husband is a horse cart driver and a fisherman. Raksmey is requesting her second loan of $300 to repair the house where she lives by making new walls.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives by making new walls

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San (in the photo) is 40 years old and his wife Sarit is 38 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have four children--three sons and one daughter. One is a gas station attendant, one attends school, another one is a monk, and the other one is still young. 

San is a chef; he cooks for wedding parties and other occasions. His wife stays at home. San wants to supplement their income with a new business--driving a "Tuk Tuk". He will be able to earn extra income when he is free. 

Hence he is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a "Tuk Tuk".

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk (motorcycle taxi) to launch a new business

loans.name: Nohy

texts.es:
Nohy de 20 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos en una casa propia en el caserío de Cayán, distrito de Huasahuasi.
Nohy se dedica a la agricultura. A su corta edad ya toma decisiones en la familia, por eso sus padres le dieron la facultad de administrar algunas parcelas de terrenos, en ellos siembra papas, arvejas,  olluco, Nashua, oca, etc. Su producción es abundante y variada, pero para eso, muy temprano por las mañanas visita sus cultivos para atenderlos. También cuenta con animales como vacas, ovejas y cerdos. Cuando no tiene otras obligaciones sale a pastearlos. Nohy es un muchacho con una proyección a crecer ya que piensa poner una tiendita para que su mamá lo administre. Tiene un buen corazón.
Y como no es un chico conformista, todos los sábados se dirige a la ciudad de Tarma para estudiar cursos de fines de semana. 
Sus metas están claras. Quiere tener estudios técnicos y continuar con su trabajo, no quiere descuidar a su familia, ya que los estima mucho. Éste sería su crédito número 6 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el Trabajo” y haciendo honor al nombre seguirá esforzándose para logras sus objetivos.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus sembríos de papas. Además pagará los servicios de los jornaleros que contratará para la cosecha de una de sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Nohy, 20 years old, is a hard working young man. He lives in the house of his parents with his siblings, in their own home in the small village of Cayán, district of Huasahuasi.

Nohy works in agriculture. At his young age he already makes decisions for the family, and as a result his parents gave him the ability to administer some of their parcels of land on which he plants potatoes, peas, etc. His production is abundant and varied, but in order to do this he must visit his crops to tend to them very early in the mornings. He also has animals such as cows, sheep and pigs. When he doesn't have other obligations he goes out to graze them. Nohy is a boy with hopes to grow his business and as such is thinking of starting a little shop that his mother can look after. He has a good heart. 

As he is not a conformist, every Saturday he goes to the city of Tarma to study weekend courses. His goals are clear. He wants to have technical studies and continue with his work, and he doesn't want to neglect his family, as he appreciates them a lot. 

This will be the 6th loan that he will obtain from Microfinanzas Prisma, and as a result he gives his word that he will be punctual with the payment of his monthly quotas. He belongs to the communal bank "Unión por el Trabajo" and giving honor to his name will continue working hard to achieve his objectives. 

He will invest the money in the purchase of sacks of organic fertilizer to fertilize his potato crop. Additionally, he will pay the services of the laborers he has contracted for the harvest of his plots.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to contract laborers.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon (in the photo) and his wife Chan are rice farmers. He had asked for a Kiva loan, and he now asks for another loan of $1,000 to purchase a water pumping machine to spray his farm and to repair his motorized hand tiller.   

Sokhon has been married since 1979 and he has three sons; one is married and lives in a separate home, another one is a garment worker, and the third one assists his parents in the farming business. The family lives about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to spray his farm and to repair his motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is 51 years old. She lives in Goris with her husband and two sons. Armida works in Goris State University as a charwoman. Armida's husband is a pensioner, and her two sons work at the local factory. To make ends meet, Armida also breeds cattle. Her farm includes three cows at present. 

Armida plans to increase the number of cattle and develop her farm. With the requested loan she plans to purchase cattle and forage. Development of cattle breeding means financial sustainability for Armida 's family. This will allow her to support her sons to start their own families and have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48 years old, married, and has three daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

Her husband operates a dairy business and has some buffaloes for that purpose. He gets up early in the morning, milks the buffaloes, and sells that milk to his community clients. His clients are very happy because he sells them fresh quality milk at very reasonable rates.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo. That will help him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.

He has been operating his business for many years. Nasreen is hopeful that the loan will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's dairy business.

loans.name: Slaiman

texts.en:
Slaiman (in the photo) is 49 years old and his wife Ousmak is 44 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They have been married since 1992 and have two sons and three daughters. Two work for a plywood factory, two others attend school and another one is still young.  

Slaiman is a fisherman. His wife stays at home because she is pregnant. Slaiman is asking for a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, age 48, is a widow with one son and two daughters. One is a garment worker and the others are in school. She lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chenda is a rice farmer. In addition, she makes "prahoc" (a popular Cambodian condiment made of fermented fish paste and salt) for sale. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy small fish and other ingredients to make "prahoc".         

Photo: Chenda is sitting next to the "prahoc" which she makes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm and buy small fish and other ingredients to make "prahoc".

loans.name: Darling Maria

texts.es: Darling, habitante de la ciudad de León, de 23 años de edad , nos comenta que desde que recibió su primer préstamo Kiva  le ha ayudado mucho ya que pudo surtir su negocio mediante la compra de mas frutas y de esta manera pude obtener mas clientela. El préstamo lo utilizo para la compra de frutas gaseosas, churritos de queso, caramelos. Ella noto que al surtir su negocio con más variedad lograba atraer mas clientes y sus ventas mejoraban. Este  segundo préstamo  que esta solicitando lo invertirá en el mismo negocio ya que venderá gaseosas , frutas,y además se dedicara ala venta de bisuterías en este negocio la apoya su mama  quien le ayuda a vender expresa que este crédito le ayudara de gran manera ya que podrá invertir mas en el negocio. Uno de sus planes es comprar un terreno para ir haciendo su casita poco a poco y además de ofrecer una gran variedad de productos para salir adelante con su negocio. Tiene como meta terminar sus estudios y desarrollar su sala de belleza.
texts.en: Darling, resident of the city of León, 23 years old, tells us that her first Kiva loan helped her to supply for her business through the purchase of more fruit, and as a result she was able to earn more clients. She used the loan to buy fruits, soda, cheese fritters and candies. She noted that stocking her business with more variety enabled her to attract more clients and her sales improved. She will invest this second loan that she is asking for in the same business and will now sell soda, fruit, and additionally will dedicate herself to the sale of jewelry. Her mom supports her in this business, and helps her to sell quickly, and this loan will help her greatly as she will be able to invest more in the business. One of her plans is to buy a plot where she will build her house little by little and additionally offer a great variety of products to get ahead in her business. Her goal is to finish her studies and develop her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy soda, fruit, and jewelry

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov (in the photo) and her husband, Sunnara, are garment workers. They have been married since 2006 and they have one young son. The family lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. 

Pov is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use to get to work.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun, age 37, is a farmer. Her husband, Oeurn, age 40, is a fisherman. They live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have seven sons. Three are employed, three attend school, and another one is still young.  


Yoeun is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son to get to work.  
     
Photo: Yoeun is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to use to get to work.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is 48 years old. She lives with her husband, who works as a guard. 

Shoghik has been engaged in cattle breeding for twelve years. Through this period she has expanded her farm, which now consists of six cows. She earns her income by selling meat and milk in the regional center at Kapan city. 

Now she wants to sell more meat and milk, for which she needs to increase the number of cattle. With this loan, Shoghik will implement this plan by purchasing two cows and forage. This will allow her to earn more income and ensure improved living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and forage.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria de 50 años de edad, madre soltera con 1 hijo, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Gloria es trabajadora y persistente con sus objetivos, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 15 años atrás, pues tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende chicharrones, asimismo +abastece de carne de chancho al mercado.
Ella es muy conocida con su negocio porque es una vendedora mas antigua del lugar, usualmente trabaja con el apoyo de su hijo pero en ocasiones cuenta con un personal quien esta a cargo del cuidado de los cerdos. Este negocio hay que dedicarle mucho, ya que es necesario estar atendiendo constantemente a los animales en especial con su alimentación y en la limpieza, para obtener una mayor producción de cerdos.
Está contenta con el negocio que tiene a pesar de que le es un poco pesado estar trasladando su comida, pero todo esto es recompensado con el buen ingreso económico que obtiene de sus ventas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que una vez más se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 4,000 nuevos soles comprará más cerdos para engordarlos y luego beneficiar su carne.
texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and the single mother of one child. They live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Gloria is hard working and persistent with her objectives, and she has been working to raise pigs for the past 15 years ago. She has a small restaurant where she sells fried pork, and she also sells pork to the market. 

She is very well known with her business because she is one of the oldest saleswomen in the place. She usually works with the support of her son but on occasion has a person who is in charge of caring for the pigs. It is necessary to dedicate a lot to this business, and as such it is necessary to always be tending to the the animals, especially with their feeding and cleaning in order to obtain increased pork production. 

She is happy with the business that she has despite the fact that it is a bit tough to be transporting her food, but all of this is rewarded with the strong income that she receives from her sales. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and as a result she once again promises to punctually pay all of her quotas.

With the 4,000 Soles she will buy more pigs in order to fatten them up and later benefit from their meat.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma de 44 años de edad convive con víctor de 49 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Enma es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a la elaboración de bloquetas de ladrillo, debido a que son muy costosos en el mercado. Por tal es que emprendió este negocio para ofrecer a un pr4ecio más comodo que la competencia. En un inicio compró una maquina moldeadora pequeña con el que empezó a elaborar dichas bloquetas y poco a poco fue creciendo y siendo muy conocida dentro del mercado. Ella esta contenta con el trabajo que realiza y sueña ser la empresaria exitosa a nivel del vrae ya que las oportunidades están dadas, solo hay que saberlas aprovechar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 4,000 nuevos soles comprará más cemento para la elaboración de bloquetas.
texts.en: Enma is 44 years old.  She lives with her partner, Victor, who is 49 and they have two children.  They live in their own home located in the district of Pichari.  Enma is an enterprising woman who makes brick blocks because they are very expensive on the market. She undertook this business in order to offer a more affordable price than the competition.  At first, she bought a small molding machine and began making these blocks.  Gradually, the business grew and she became well-known in the market.  She is happy with the work that she is doing and dreams of being a successful business woman in the VRAE (River Apurímac and River Ene Valley) region.  She says that opportunities are given but we must know how to take advantage of them.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time.  With the 4,000 nuevos soles, she will purchase more cement to construct the brick blocks.

loans.use: to purchase more cement to make bricks.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son left his education after the fifth and started a welding business while her remaining children are continuing their education. Her husband is an ice cream seller. He prepares great tasting ice cream, which his customers like very much.

Shumaila is very supportive and operates a decorative embroidery business from her home. She has great artistic skills and makes beautiful looking embroidered clothes for her clients. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy beads, embroidery thread, frames etc in larger quantity and of a different variety that will allow her to attract more clients by producing better quality embroidered clothes and increase her profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shumaila.

loans.use: To buy beads, threads etc

loans.name: Zagipa

texts.ru:
Загипе 61 год, вдова, поживает с семьей сына и заботится о внуке. Загипа проработала учителем начальных классов в течение 36 лет, сейчас на пенсии. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для семьи, в 1996 году Загипа начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве.  Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Загипы, начатое с суммы в 12,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, Загипа возделывает 3,66 га земли, где выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Загипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и семян высокоурожайного картофеля. Доходы Загипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zagipa is 61 years old.  She lives with her son's family and takes care of her grandson.  Zagipa worked for 36 years as an elementary school teacher, and she is now retired.  For a source of supplemental income for her family, in 1996 Zagipa started her own business in animal husbandry and farming.  
Thanks to her tenacity and perseverance, the business she started with 12,000 soum (KGS) now brings in about 8,000 soum per month from the sale of dairy and meat products.  Zagipa also cultivates 3.66 ha, where she grows potatoes, cereal crops, and sainfoin.

With the goal of further development of her business, Zagipa turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 soum (KGS) for the purchase of cattle and seed for high-yield potatoes. Zagipa is planning to invest the income in further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and potato seeds

loans.name: Candida Rosa
