texts.es: Doña Cándida es originaria de Estelí tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta en la escuela, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida. Inicio sus actividades con dinero propio el cual obtuvo trabajando en una fábrica de puros ala edad de 26 años. Desde entonces se ha convertido en su único medio de subsistencia. Se siente satisfecha  con el lugar donde tiene ubicado su negocio ya que esta en un buen lugar cerca de la universidad donde la mayoría de sus clientes son estudiantes y profesores, le ha generado  buenas ganancias. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, arroz, pollo, carne, verduras, aceite, frijoles, plátanos. Pues son ingredientes que utiliza para hacer sus platillos. Con esta inversión va ofrecer una variedad de comida a sus clientes. Uno de sus planes es comprar sillas y mesas plásticas para darles una mejor atención a los clientes. Tiene como meta ir construyendo su casa poco a poco y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Doña Cándida is a native of Estelí.  She has two children and only one of them is in school.  She works in food sales.  She started her business with her own money, which she earned working in a cigar factory at the age of 26. Since then, her business has become her only means of subsistence.  Her business is in good area near the university and she is happy with this location. Most of her customers are students and professors, and she has earned good profits.  She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, oil, beans, and bananas.  These are the ingredients she uses to prepare her dishes.  This investment will enable her to offer a variety of meals to her customers.  One of her plans is to buy plastic tables and chairs in order to provide her customers with better service.  Her other goals are to gradually build a home and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, oil, beans, and bananas.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Né vers Avril 1985 à Sikasso, Monsieur Seydou est marié et père de trois enfants, il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie  à Banconi  l’un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 
Monsieur Seydou est un réparateur d’engin à deux roues de profession depuis plus de quinze années. Pour faciliter à ses clients d’acquérir des pièces d’occasion d’origine, il mène en parallèle avec son métier l’achat-vente des pièces d’occasion. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il  est à son un premier prêt individuel.
 Il compte acheter avec ce  prêt,   des pièces d’occasion d’origine : dix bielles, 5 arbre à came, 10 pistons, 3 jantes et 5 carters. Les marchandises (pièces) sont achetées sur places à Sikasso 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 195 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around April 1985 in Sikasso, Mr. Seydou is married and the father of three. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional extended family in Banconi, a working-class distrit of the town of Sikasso.

For over 15 years, Mr. Seydou has been repairing motorbike engines. In order to make it easier for his clients to obtain brand-name used spare parts, he also sells spare parts in addition to his work. He is very much in demand thanks to the quality of his goods. In order to meet  growing customer demand, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and is now on his first individual loan. He plans to use thi loan in order to buy 10 connecting roads, five camshafts, 10 pistons, three wheel rims and five crankcases. The spare parts will be bought locally in Sikasso.

With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly income of 195,000 West African Francs, which will be used essentially to contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on his loan, with the rest reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy used spare parts

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 38 years old, and his wife, Phala, is 33 years old. They live in a small village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children - two sons and one daughter. One is in school and the other two are still too young. 

Chantha has one set of musical instruments usually called Thong Bas in Khmer. The people in the countryside prefer to rent Thong Bas to entertain and dance in weddings, some religious ceremonies, and, especially, during the Khmer New Year.

Besides his business of renting out Thong Bas to his villagers, Chantha also built a water storage tower and has distributed water to houses in the neighborhood. He runs a private water utility service. His wife is a garment worker.  

Chantha is now in the process of building his kitchen (pictured), but the kitchen is not finished yet. Hence, he decided to request a loan to finish it.

loans.use: To finish his kitchen.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap and her husband, Vy (pictured together), live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 km from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have four sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, two weave silk at home and the others attend school.

Sopheap is a weaver and assists her husband in the farming business when she is free. Sopheap has asked for a Kiva loan previously. She now requests another loan of US $500 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and to buy a water-pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, pesticide and a water pumping machine

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She started her business because her husband's income was not enough for the whole family. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine to be able to complete the client orders on time and increase her profits.

Sughran has five sons. Two of them work in a factory making shopping bags, while the others remain at home. Due to financial constraints Sughran is unable to provide an education for her children. She is a very confident lady and very hopeful about the bright future of her family as a result of the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband, Ny, is 30 years old. They live in a village about 17 km from Phnom Penh City and they have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in school and another one is still young.   

Chanthy sells fruit and her husband is a construction worker. Chanthy carries fruit on her motorbike, but the motorbike is old and uses more gasoline than the new ones.  Hence, she decided to apply for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.
